candidates.title: #13 authentication read access

milestone.title: v0.29 - authorization
milestone.description: Improved authorization / rights checking. Towards an `atomic-server` that you can use for private data!

candidates.body:
#13 #11 #132

Some things left to do before merging:

- [x] version(s) endpoint(s) auth check
- [x] rust auth client logic

Possible authorization failures to test:

- [x] Resource endpoint
- [x] Search endpoint
- [x] Changing rights
- [ ] Websockets (subscribing to unauthorized things)
- [x] TPF (currently disabled unless public mode)

candidates.body:
#62 

See also: https://github.com/joepio/atomic-data-browser/pull/99

candidates.title: Huge refactor, add  collection sorting, fix internal data consistency
candidates.body:
- Get rid of `resource_string` representation
- In-memory `Store` uses `Resources`
- Only validated data enters the store
- Had to move some data from `default_store.ad3` to the `populate` function to fix a recursive bug when initalizing the store (long story)
- Added Collection sorting #63 
- Made the `validate` method pretty much obsolete. Only valid data enters the store.
- More things

candidates.title: Auto renew let's encrypt certs on start #47
candidates.body: When atomic-server is in HTTPS mode, it will check if the certificates are 4 weeks or older. If true, it will request new ones.

candidates.title: Client-server write interaction, post commits from CLI
Get rid of &mut #15
candidates.body:
So I've managed to get rid of the `&mut` thing #15 using Arcs and Mutexes. Everything works fine.

But I'm still wondering if this is the way to go - I'm a bit worried about performance overhead. Haven't done any benchmarks.

candidates.title: SSL HTTPS Cert init automation #8
candidates.body: Fixes #8

candidates.title: Persistent storage using transactions, Delta processing, validate command, more fun stuff,

repo.name: atomic-server
repo.description: An open source headless CMS / real-time database. Powerful table editor, full-text search, and SDKs for JS / React / Svelte.
